Siree Raag − Part 001 14 : 1 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 14 : 2 Raag Siree Raag, First Mehl, First House: 14 : 3 If I had a palace made of pearls, inlaid with jewels, 14 : 4 scented with musk, saffron and sandalwood, a sheer delight to behold 14 : 5 −seeing this, I might go astray and forget You, and Your Name would not enter into my mind. ||1|| 14 : 6 Without the Lord, my soul is scorched and burnt. 14 : 7 I consulted my Guru, and now I see that there is no other place at all. ||1||Pause|| 14 : 8 If the floor of this palace was a mosaic of diamonds and rubies, and if my bed was encased with rubies, 14 : 9 and if heavenly beauties, their faces adorned with emeralds, tried to entice me with sensual 2

gestures of love 14 : 10 −seeing these, I might go astray and forget You, and Your Name would not enter into my mind. ||2|| 14 : 11 If I were to become a Siddha, and work miracles, summon wealth 14 : 12 and become invisible and visible at will, so that people would hold me in awe 14 : 13 −seeing these, I might go astray and forget You, and Your Name would not enter into my mind. ||3|| 14 : 14 If I were to become an emperor and raise a huge army, and sit on a throne, 14 : 15 issuing commands and collecting taxes−O Nanak, all of this could pass away like a puff of wind. 14 : 16 Seeing these, I might go astray and forget You, and Your Name would not enter into my mind. ||4||1|| 14 : 17 Siree Raag, First Mehl: 14 : 18 Siree Raag − Part 001 3

If I could live for millions and millions of years, and if the air was my food and drink, 14 : 19 and if I lived in a cave and never saw either the sun or the moon, and if I never slept, even in dreams 14 : 20 −even so, I could not estimate Your Value. How can I describe the Greatness of Your Name? ||1|| 14 : 21 The True Lord, the Formless One, is Himself in His Own Place. 14 : 22 I have heard, over and over again, and so I tell the tale; as it pleases You, Lord, please instill within me the yearning for You. ||1||Pause|| 14 : 23 If I was slashed and cut into pieces, over and over again, and put into the mill and ground into flour, 14 : 24 burnt by fire and mixed with ashes 14 : 25 −even then, I could not estimate Your Value. How can I describe the Greatness of Your Name? ||2|| 14 : 26 If I was a bird, soaring and flying through hundreds of heavens, 14 : 27 Siree Raag − Part 001 4

and if I was invisible, neither eating nor drinking anything 14 : 28 −even so, I could not estimate Your Value. How can I describe the Greatness of Your Name? ||3|| −− Siree Raag − Part 001 −− Siree Raag − Part 001 5

Siree Raag − Part 002 15 : 29 O Nanak, if I had hundreds of thousands of stacks of paper, and if I were to read and recite and embrace love for the Lord, 15 : 30 and if ink were never to fail me, and if my pen were able to move like the wind 15 : 31 −even so, I could not estimate Your Value. How can I describe the Greatness of Your Name? ||4||2|| 15 : 32 Siree Raag, First Mehl: 15 : 33 As it is pre−ordained, people speak their words. As it is pre−ordained, they consume their food. 15 : 34 As it is pre−ordained, they walk along the way. As it is pre−ordained, they see and hear. 15 : 35 As it is pre−ordained, they draw their breath. Why should I go and ask the scholars about this? ||1|| 15 : 36 O Baba, the splendor of Maya is deceptive. 15 : 37 6

The blind man has forgotten the Name; he is in limbo, neither here nor there. ||1||Pause|| 15 : 38 Life and death come to all who are born. Everything here gets devoured by Death. 15 : 39 He sits and examines the accounts, there where no one goes along with anyone. 15 : 40 Those who weep and wail might just as well all tie bundles of straw. ||2|| 15 : 41 Everyone says that God is the Greatest of the Great. No one calls Him any less. 15 : 42 No one can estimate His Worth. By speaking of Him, His Greatness is not increased. 15 : 43 You are the One True Lord and Master of all the other beings, of so many worlds. ||3|| 15 : 44 Nanak seeks the company of the lowest of the low class, the very lowest of the low. Why should he try to compete with the great? 15 : 45 In that place where the lowly are cared for−there, the Blessings of Your Glance of Grace rain down. ||4||3|| 15 : 46 Siree Raag, First Mehl: Siree Raag − Part 002 7

15 : 47 Greed is a dog; falsehood is a filthy street−sweeper. Cheating is eating a rotting carcass. 15 : 48 Slandering others is putting the filth of others into your own mouth. The fire of anger is the outcaste who burns dead bodies at the crematorium. 15 : 49 I am caught in these tastes and flavors, and in self−conceited praise. These are my actions, O my Creator! ||1|| 15 : 50 O Baba, speak only that which will bring you honor. 15 : 51 They alone are good, who are judged good at the Lord's Door. Those with bad karma can only sit and weep. ||1||Pause|| 15 : 52 The pleasures of gold and silver, the pleasures of women, the pleasure of the fragrance of sandalwood, 15 : 53 the pleasure of horses, the pleasure of a soft bed in a palace, the pleasure of sweet treats and the pleasure of hearty meals 15 : 54 −these pleasures of the human body are so numerous; how can the Naam, the Name of the Lord, find its dwelling in the heart? ||2|| 15 : 55 Those words are acceptable, which, when spoken, bring honor. Siree Raag − Part 002 8

15 : 56 Harsh words bring only grief. Listen, O foolish and ignorant mind! 15 : 57 Those who are pleasing to Him are good. What else is there to be said? ||3|| 15 : 58 Wisdom, honor and wealth are in the laps of those whose hearts remain permeated with the Lord. 15 : 59 What praise can be offered to them? What other adornments can be bestowed upon them? 15 : 60 O Nanak, those who lack the Lord's Glance of Grace cherish neither charity nor the Lord's Name. ||4||4|| 15 : 61 Siree Raag, First Mehl: 15 : 62 The Great Giver has given the intoxicating drug of falsehood. 15 : 63 The people are intoxicated; they have forgotten death, and they have fun for a few days. 15 : 64 Those who do not use intoxicants are true; they dwell in the Court of the Lord. ||1|| 15 : 65 Siree Raag − Part 002 9

O Nanak, know the True Lord as True. 15 : 66 Serving Him, peace is obtained; you shall go to His Court with honor. ||1||Pause|| 15 : 67 The Wine of Truth is not fermented from molasses. The True Name is contained within it. −− Siree Raag − Part 002 −− Siree Raag − Part 002 10

Siree Raag − Part 003 16 : 68 I am a sacrifice to those who hear and chant the True Name. 16 : 69 Only one who obtains a room in the Mansion of the Lord's Presence is deemed to be truly intoxicated. ||2|| 16 : 70 Bathe in the waters of Goodness and apply the scented oil of Truth to your body, 16 : 71 and your face shall become radiant. This is the gift of 100,000 gifts. 16 : 72 Tell your troubles to the One who is the Source of all comfort. ||3|| 16 : 73 How can you forget the One who created your soul, and the praanaa, the breath of life? 16 : 74 Without Him, all that we wear and eat is impure. 16 : 75 Everything else is false. Whatever pleases Your Will is acceptable. ||4||5|| 16 : 76 Siree Raag, First Mehl: 11

16 : 77 Burn emotional attachment, and grind it into ink. Transform your intelligence into the purest of paper. 16 : 78 Make the love of the Lord your pen, and let your consciousness be the scribe. Then, seek the Guru's Instructions, and record these deliberations. 16 : 79 Write the Praises of the Naam, the Name of the Lord; write over and over again that He has no end or limitation. ||1|| 16 : 80 O Baba, write such an account, 16 : 81 that when it is asked for, it will bring the Mark of Truth. ||1||Pause|| 16 : 82 There, where greatness, eternal peace and everlasting joy are bestowed, 16 : 83 the faces of those whose minds are attuned to the True Name are anointed with the Mark of Grace. 16 : 84 If one receives God's Grace, then such honors are received, and not by mere words. ||2|| 16 : 85 Some come, and some arise and depart. They give themselves lofty names. Siree Raag − Part 003 12

16 : 86 Some are born beggars, and some hold vast courts. 16 : 87 Going to the world hereafter, everyone shall realize that without the Name, it is all useless. ||3|| 16 : 88 I am terrified by the Fear of You, God. Bothered and bewildered, my body is wasting away. 16 : 89 Those who are known as sultans and emperors shall be reduced to dust in the end. 16 : 90 O Nanak, arising and departing, all false attachments are cut away. ||4||6|| 16 : 91 Siree Raag, First Mehl: 16 : 92 Believing, all tastes are sweet. Hearing, the salty flavors are tasted; 16 : 93 chanting with one's mouth, the spicy flavors are savored. All these spices have been made from the Sound−current of the Naad. 16 : 94 The thirty−six flavors of ambrosial nectar are in the Love of the One Lord; they are tasted only by one who is blessed by His Glance of Grace. ||1|| 16 : 95 Siree Raag − Part 003 13

O Baba, the pleasures of other foods are false. 16 : 96 Eating them, the body is ruined, and wickedness and corruption enter into the mind. ||1||Pause|| 16 : 97 My mind is imbued with the Lord's Love; it is dyed a deep crimson. Truth and charity are my white clothes. 16 : 98 The blackness of sin is erased by my wearing of blue clothes, and meditation on the Lord's Lotus Feet is my robe of honor. 16 : 99 Contentment is my cummerbund, Your Name is my wealth and youth. ||2|| 16 : 100 O Baba, the pleasures of other clothes are false. 16 : 101 Wearing them, the body is ruined, and wickedness and corruption enter into the mind. ||1||Pause|| 16 : 102 The understanding of Your Way, Lord, is horses, saddles and bags of gold for me. 16 : 103 The pursuit of virtue is my bow and arrow, my quiver, sword and scabbard. 16 : 104 Siree Raag − Part 003 14

To be distinguished with honor is my drum and banner. Your Mercy is my social status. ||3|| 16 : 105 O Baba, the pleasures of other rides are false. 16 : 106 By such rides, the body is ruined, and wickedness and corruption enter into the mind. ||1||Pause|| 16 : 107 The Naam, the Name of the Lord, is the pleasure of houses and mansions. Your Glance of Grace is my family, Lord. −− Siree Raag − Part 003 −− Siree Raag − Part 003 15

Siree Raag − Part 004 17 : 108 The Hukam of Your Command is the pleasure of Your Will, Lord. To say anything else is far beyond anyone's reach. 17 : 109 O Nanak, the True King does not seek advice from anyone else in His decisions. ||4|| 17 : 110 O Baba, the pleasure of other sleep is false. 17 : 111 By such sleep, the body is ruined, and wickedness and corruption enter into the mind. ||1||Pause||4||7|| 17 : 112 Siree Raag, First Mehl: 17 : 113 With the body of saffron, and the tongue a jewel, and the breath of the body pure fragrant incense; 17 : 114 with the face anointed at the sixty−eight holy places of pilgrimage, and the heart illuminated with wisdom 17 : 115 −with that wisdom, chant the Praises of the True Name, the Treasure of Excellence. ||1|| 17 : 116 16

O Baba, other wisdom is useless and irrelevant. 17 : 117 If falsehood is practiced a hundred times, it is still false in its effects. ||1||Pause|| 17 : 118 You may be worshipped and adored as a Pir (a spiritual teacher); you may be welcomed by all the world; 17 : 119 you may adopt a lofty name, and be known to have supernatural spiritual powers 17 : 120 −even so, if you are not accepted in the Court of the Lord, then all this adoration is false. ||2|| 17 : 121 No one can overthrow those who have been established by the True Guru. 17 : 122 The Treasure of the Naam, the Name of the Lord, is within them, and through the Naam, they are radiant and famous. 17 : 123 They worship the Naam, and they believe in the Naam. The True One is forever Intact and Unbroken. ||3|| 17 : 124 When the body mingles with dust, what happens to the soul? 17 : 125 Siree Raag − Part 004 17

All clever tricks are burnt away, and you shall depart crying. 17 : 126 O Nanak, those who forget the Naam−what will happen when they go to the Court of the Lord? ||4||8|| 17 : 127 Siree Raag, First Mehl: 17 : 128 The virtuous wife exudes virtue; the unvirtuous suffer in misery. 17 : 129 If you long for your Husband Lord, O soul−bride, you must know that He is not met by falsehood. 17 : 130 No boat or raft can take you to Him. Your Husband Lord is far away. ||1|| 17 : 131 My Lord and Master is Perfect; His Throne is Eternal and Immovable. 17 : 132 One who attains perfection as Gurmukh, obtains the Immeasurable True Lord. ||1||Pause|| 17 : 133 The Palace of the Lord God is so beautiful. Within it, there are gems, rubies, pearls and flawless diamonds. A fortress of gold surrounds this Source of Nectar. 17 : 134 Siree Raag − Part 004 18

How can I climb up to the Fortress without a ladder? By meditating on the Lord, through the Guru, I am blessed and exalted. ||2|| 17 : 135 The Guru is the Ladder, the Guru is the Boat, and the Guru is the Raft to take me to the Lord's Name. 17 : 136 The Guru is the Boat to carry me across the world−ocean; the Guru is the Sacred Shrine of Pilgrimage, the Guru is the Holy River. 17 : 137 If it pleases Him, I bathe in the Pool of Truth, and become radiant and pure. ||3|| 17 : 138 He is called the Most Perfect of the Perfect. He sits upon His Perfect Throne. 17 : 139 He looks so Beautiful in His Perfect Place. He fulfills the hopes of the hopeless. 17 : 140 O Nanak, if one obtains the Perfect Lord, how can his virtues decrease? ||4||9|| 17 : 141 Siree Raag, First Mehl: 17 : 142 Come, my dear sisters and spiritual companions; hug me close in your embrace. 17 : 143 Let's join together, and tell stories of our All−powerful Husband Lord. Siree Raag − Part 004 19

17 : 144 All Virtues are in our True Lord and Master; we are utterly without virtue. ||1|| 17 : 145 O Creator Lord, all are in Your Power. 17 : 146 I dwell upon the One Word of the Shabad. You are mine−what else do I need? ||1||Pause|| 17 : 147 Go, and ask the happy soul−brides, "By what virtuous qualities do you enjoy your Husband Lord?" 17 : 148 "We are adorned with intuitive ease, contentment and sweet words. 17 : 149 We meet with our Beloved, the Source of Joy, when we listen to the Word of the Guru's Shabad."||2|| −− Siree Raag − Part 004 −− Siree Raag − Part 004 20

Siree Raag − Part 005 18 : 150 You have so many Creative Powers, Lord; Your Bountiful Blessings are so Great. 18 : 151 So many of Your beings and creatures praise You day and night. 18 : 152 You have so many forms and colors, so many classes, high and low. ||3|| 18 : 153 Meeting the True One, Truth wells up. The truthful are absorbed into the True Lord. 18 : 154 Intuitive understanding is obtained and one is welcomed with honor, through the Guru's Word, filled with the Fear of God. 18 : 155 O Nanak, the True King absorbs us into Himself. ||4||10|| 18 : 156 Siree Raag, First Mehl: 18 : 157 It all worked out−I was saved, and the egotism within my heart was subdued. 18 : 158 The evil energies have been made to serve me, since I placed my faith in the True Guru. 21

18 : 159 I have renounced my useless schemes, by the Grace of the True, Carefree Lord. ||1|| 18 : 160 O mind, meeting with the True One, fear departs. 18 : 161 Without the Fear of God, how can anyone become fearless? Become Gurmukh, and immerse yourself in the Shabad. ||1||Pause|| 18 : 162 How can we describe Him with words? There is no end to the descriptions of Him. 18 : 163 There are so many beggars, but He is the only Giver. 18 : 164 He is the Giver of the soul, and the praanaa, the breath of life; when He dwells within the mind, there is peace. ||2|| 18 : 165 The world is a drama, staged in a dream. In a moment, the play is played out. 18 : 166 Some attain union with the Lord, while others depart in separation. 18 : 167 Whatever pleases Him comes to pass; nothing else can be done. ||3|| 18 : 168 Siree Raag − Part 005 22

The Gurmukhs purchase the Genuine Article. The True Merchandise is purchased with the True Capital. 18 : 169 Those who purchase this True Merchandise through the Perfect Guru are blessed. 18 : 170 O Nanak, one who stocks this True Merchandise shall recognize and realize the Genuine Article. ||4||11|| 18 : 171 Siree Raag, First Mehl: 18 : 172 As metal merges with metal, those who chant the Praises of the Lord are absorbed into the Praiseworthy Lord. 18 : 173 Like the poppies, they are dyed in the deep crimson color of Truthfulness. 18 : 174 Those contented souls who meditate on the Lord with single−minded love, meet the True Lord. ||1|| 18 : 175 O Siblings of Destiny, become the dust of the feet of the humble Saints. 18 : 176 In the Society of the Saints, the Guru is found. He is the Treasure of Liberation, the Source of all good fortune. ||1||Pause|| 18 : 177 Siree Raag − Part 005 23

Upon that Highest Plane of Sublime Beauty, stands the Mansion of the Lord. 18 : 178 By true actions, this human body is obtained, and the door within ourselves which leads to the Mansion of the Beloved, is found. 18 : 179 The Gurmukhs train their minds to contemplate the Lord, the Supreme Soul. ||2|| 18 : 180 By actions committed under the influence of the three qualities, hope and anxiety are produced. 18 : 181 Without the Guru, how can anyone be released from these three qualities? Through intuitive wisdom, we meet with Him and find peace. 18 : 182 Within the home of the self, the Mansion of His Presence is realized when He bestows His Glance of Grace and washes away our pollution. ||3|| 18 : 183 Without the Guru, this pollution is not removed. Without the Lord, how can there be any homecoming? 18 : 184 Contemplate the One Word of the Shabad, and abandon other hopes. 18 : 185 O Nanak, I am forever a sacrifice to the one who beholds, and inspires others to behold Him. ||4||12|| Siree Raag − Part 005 24

18 : 186 Siree Raag, First Mehl: 18 : 187 The life of the discarded bride is cursed. She is deceived by the love of duality. 18 : 188 Like a wall of sand, day and night, she crumbles, and eventually, she breaks down altogether. 18 : 189 Without the Word of the Shabad, peace does not come. Without her Husband Lord, her suffering does not end. ||1|| 18 : 190 O soul−bride, without your Husband Lord, what good are your decorations? −− Siree Raag − Part 005 −− Siree Raag − Part 005 25

Siree Raag − Part 006 19 : 191 In this world, you shall not find any shelter; in the world hereafter, being false, you shall suffer. ||1||Pause|| 19 : 192 The True Lord Himself knows all; He makes no mistakes. He is the Great Farmer of the Universe. 19 : 193 First, He prepares the ground, and then He plants the Seed of the True Name. 19 : 194 The nine treasures are produced from Name of the One Lord. By His Grace, we obtain His Banner and Insignia. ||2|| 19 : 195 Some are very knowledgeable, but if they do not know the Guru, then what is the use of their lives? 19 : 196 The blind have forgotten the Naam, the Name of the Lord. The self−willed manmukhs are in utter darkness. 19 : 197 Their comings and goings in reincarnation do not end; through death and rebirth, they are wasting away. ||3|| 19 : 198 The bride may buy sandalwood oil and perfumes, and apply them in great quantities to her hair; 26

19 : 199 she may sweeten her breath with betel leaf and camphor, 19 : 200 but if this bride is not pleasing to her Husband Lord, then all these trappings are false. ||4|| 19 : 201 Her enjoyment of all pleasures is futile, and all her decorations are corrupt. 19 : 202 Until she has been pierced through with the Shabad, how can she look beautiful at Guru's Gate? 19 : 203 O Nanak, blessed is that fortunate bride, who is in love with her Husband Lord. ||5||13|| 19 : 204 Siree Raag, First Mehl: 19 : 205 The empty body is dreadful, when the soul goes out from within. 19 : 206 The burning fire of life is extinguished, and the smoke of the breath no longer emerges. 19 : 207 The five relatives (the senses) weep and wail painfully, and waste away through the love of duality. ||1|| 19 : 208 Siree Raag − Part 006 27

You fool: chant the Name of the Lord, and preserve your virtue. 19 : 209 Egotism and possessiveness are very enticing; egotistical pride has plundered everyone. ||1||Pause|| 19 : 210 Those who have forgotten the Naam, the Name of the Lord, are attached to affairs of duality. 19 : 211 Attached to duality, they putrefy and die; they are filled with the fire of desire within. 19 : 212 Those who are protected by the Guru are saved; all others are cheated and plundered by deceitful worldly affairs. ||2|| 19 : 213 Love dies, and affection vanishes. Hatred and alienation die. 19 : 214 Entanglements end, and egotism dies, along with attachment to Maya, possessiveness and anger. 19 : 215 Those who receive His Mercy obtain the True One. The Gurmukhs dwell forever in balanced restraint. ||3|| 19 : 216 By true actions, the True Lord is met, and the Guru's Teachings are found. 19 : 217 Siree Raag − Part 006 28

Then, they are not subject to birth and death; they do not come and go in reincarnation. 19 : 218 O Nanak, they are respected at the Lord's Gate; they are robed in honor in the Court of the Lord. ||4||14|| 19 : 219 Siree Raag, First Mehl: 19 : 220 The body is burnt to ashes; by its love of Maya, the mind is rusted through. 19 : 221 Demerits become one's enemies, and falsehood blows the bugle of attack. 19 : 222 Without the Word of the Shabad, people wander lost in reincarnation. Through the love of duality, multitudes have been drowned. ||1|| 19 : 223 O mind, swim across, by focusing your consciousness on the Shabad. 19 : 224 Those who do not become Gurmukh do not understand the Naam; they die, and continue coming and going in reincarnation. ||1||Pause|| 19 : 225 That body is said to be pure, in which the True Name abides. 19 : 226 Siree Raag − Part 006 29

One whose body is imbued with the Fear of the True One, and whose tongue savors Truthfulness, 19 : 227 is brought to ecstasy by the True Lord's Glance of Grace. That person does not have to go through the fire of the womb again. ||2|| 19 : 228 From the True Lord came the air, and from the air came water. 19 : 229 From water, He created the three worlds; in each and every heart He has infused His Light. 19 : 230 The Immaculate Lord does not become polluted. Attuned to the Shabad, honor is obtained. ||3|| 19 : 231 One whose mind is contented with Truthfulness, is blessed with the Lord's Glance of Grace. −− Siree Raag − Part 006 −− Siree Raag − Part 006 30

Siree Raag − Part 007 20 : 232 The body of the five elements is dyed in the Fear of the True One; the mind is filled with the True Light. 20 : 233 O Nanak, your demerits shall be forgotten; the Guru shall preserve your honor. ||4||15|| 20 : 234 Siree Raag, First Mehl: 20 : 235 O Nanak, the Boat of Truth will ferry you across; contemplate the Guru. 20 : 236 Some come, and some go; they are totally filled with egotism. 20 : 237 Through stubborn−mindedness, the intellect is drowned; one who becomes Gurmukh and truthful is saved. ||1|| 20 : 238 Without the Guru, how can anyone swim across to find peace? 20 : 239 As it pleases You, Lord, You save me. There is no other for me at all. ||1||Pause|| 20 : 240 In front of me, I see the jungle burning; behind me, I see green plants sprouting. 31

20 : 241 We shall merge into the One from whom we came. The True One is pervading each and every heart. 20 : 242 He Himself unites us in Union with Himself; the True Mansion of His Presence is close at hand. ||2|| 20 : 243 With each and every breath, I dwell upon You; I shall never forget You. 20 : 244 The more the Lord and Master dwells within the mind, the more the Gurmukh drinks in the Ambrosial Nectar. 20 : 245 Mind and body are Yours; You are my Master. Please rid me of my pride, and let me merge with You. ||3|| 20 : 246 The One who formed this universe created the creation of the three worlds. 20 : 247 The Gurmukh knows the Divine Light, while the foolish self−willed manmukh gropes around in the darkness. 20 : 248 One who sees that Light within each and every heart understands the Essence of the Guru's Teachings. ||4|| 20 : 249 Those who understand are Gurmukh; recognize and applaud them. Siree Raag − Part 007 32

20 : 250 They meet and merge with the True One. They become the Radiant Manifestation of the Excellence of the True One. 20 : 251 O Nanak, they are contented with the Naam, the Name of the Lord. They offer their bodies and souls to God. ||5||16|| 20 : 252 Siree Raag, First Mehl: 20 : 253 Listen, O my mind, my friend, my darling: now is the time to meet the Lord. 20 : 254 As long as there is youth and breath, give this body to Him. 20 : 255 Without virtue, it is useless; the body shall crumble into a pile of dust. ||1|| 20 : 256 O my mind, earn the profit, before you return home. 20 : 257 The Gurmukh praises the Naam, and the fire of egotism is extinguished. ||1||Pause|| 20 : 258 Again and again, we hear and tell stories; we read and write and understand loads of knowledge, 20 : 259 Siree Raag − Part 007 33

but still, desires increase day and night, and the disease of egotism fills us with corruption. 20 : 260 That Carefree Lord cannot be appraised; His Real Value is known only through the Wisdom of the Guru's Teachings. ||2|| 20 : 261 Even if someone has hundreds of thousands of clever mental tricks, and the love and company of hundreds of thousands of people 20 : 262 −still, without the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, he will not feel satisfied. Without the Name, all suffer in sorrow. 20 : 263 Chanting the Name of the Lord, O my soul, you shall be emancipated; as Gurmukh, you shall come to understand your own self. ||3|| 20 : 264 I have sold my body and mind to the Guru, and I have given my mind and head as well. 20 : 265 I was seeking and searching for Him throughout the three worlds; then, as Gurmukh, I sought and found Him. 20 : 266 The True Guru has united me in Union, O Nanak, with that God. ||4||17|| 20 : 267 Siree Raag, First Mehl: 20 : 268 Siree Raag − Part 007 34

I have no anxiety about dying, and no hope of living. 20 : 269 You are the Cherisher of all beings; You keep the account of our breaths and morsels of food. 20 : 270 You abide within the Gurmukh. As it pleases You, You decide our allotment. ||1|| 20 : 271 O my soul, chant the Name of the Lord; the mind will be pleased and appeased. 20 : 272 The raging fire within is extinguished; the Gurmukh obtains spiritual wisdom. ||1||Pause|| −− Siree Raag − Part 007 −− Siree Raag − Part 007 35

Siree Raag − Part 008 21 : 273 Know the state of your inner being; meet with the Guru and get rid of your skepticism. 21 : 274 To reach your True Home after you die, you must conquer death while you are still alive. 21 : 275 The beautiful, Unstruck Sound of the Shabad is obtained, contemplating the Guru. ||2|| 21 : 276 The Unstruck Melody of Gurbani is obtained, and egotism is eliminated. 21 : 277 I am forever a sacrifice to those who serve their True Guru. 21 : 278 They are dressed in robes of honor in the Court of the Lord; the Name of the Lord is on their lips. ||3|| 21 : 279 Wherever I look, I see the Lord pervading there, in the union of Shiva and Shakti, of consciousness and matter. 21 : 280 The three qualities hold the body in bondage; whoever comes into the world is subject to their play. 21 : 281 36

Those who separate themselves from the Lord wander lost in misery. The self−willed manmukhs do not attain union with Him. ||4|| 21 : 282 If the mind becomes balanced and detached, and comes to dwell in its own true home, imbued with the Fear of God, 21 : 283 then it enjoys the essence of supreme spiritual wisdom; it shall never feel hunger again. 21 : 284 O Nanak, conquer and subdue this mind; meet with the Lord, and you shall never again suffer in pain. ||5||18|| 21 : 285 Siree Raag, First Mehl: 21 : 286 This foolish mind is greedy; through greed, it becomes even more attached to greed. 21 : 287 The evil−minded shaaktas, the faithless cynics, are not attuned to the Shabad; they come and go in reincarnation. 21 : 288 One who meets with the Holy True Guru finds the Treasure of Excellence. ||1|| 21 : 289 O mind, renounce your egotistical pride. 21 : 290 Siree Raag − Part 008 37

Serve the Lord, the Guru, the Sacred Pool, and you shall be honored in the Court of the Lord. ||1||Pause|| 21 : 291 Chant the Name of the Lord day and night; become Gurmukh, and know the Wealth of the Lord. 21 : 292 All comforts and peace, and the Essence of the Lord, are enjoyed by acquiring spiritual wisdom in the Society of the Saints. 21 : 293 Day and night, continually serve the Lord God; the True Guru has given the Naam. ||2|| 21 : 294 Those who practice falsehood are dogs; those who slander the Guru shall burn in their own fire. 21 : 295 They wander lost and confused, deceived by doubt, suffering in terrible pain. The Messenger of Death shall beat them to a pulp. 21 : 296 The self−willed manmukhs find no peace, while the Gurmukhs are wondrously joyful. ||3|| 21 : 297 In this world, people are engrossed in false pursuits, but in the world hereafter, only the account of your true actions is accepted. 21 : 298 The Guru serves the Lord, His Intimate Friend. The Guru's actions are supremely exalted. Siree Raag − Part 008 38

21 : 299 O Nanak, never forget the Naam, the Name of the Lord; the True Lord shall bless you with His Mark of Grace. ||4||19|| 21 : 300 Siree Raag, First Mehl: 21 : 301 Forgetting the Beloved, even for a moment, the mind is afflicted with terrible diseases. 21 : 302 How can honor be attained in His Court, if the Lord does not dwell in the mind? 21 : 303 Meeting with the Guru, peace is found.
